thread.title: Easton girls dominate to win EPC cross country championship
thread.title_full: Easton girls dominate to win EPC cross country championship

title: Easton girls dominate to win EPC cross country championship
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Eastern Pennsylvania Conference girls cross country championship -- Rapid Recap 
Easton gathered the one prize that eluded them in 2014 by storming to the team title with 52 points to runner-up Stroudsburg’s 84. Liberty junior Raisa Kochmaruk repeated as individual champion in a time of 18 minutes, 52 seconds on the course at the Bethlehem Executive Municipal Golf Course. 
Turning point: The Rovers put their first five runners in the top 17. Game, set, match. 
Top performer: Kochmaruk dropped her time 25 seconds from her best time on this course last season. 
What it means: Markers have been laid down for next week’s District 11 championships on the same course. Easton and Kochmaruk will both be tough to beat. 
Brad Wilson may be reached at bwilson@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @bradwsports . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook .
